response.original_title: Transfiguración: La mirada que me habita
response.overview: Carla, an art curator, obsessively prepares the most important exhibition of her career. Between the weight of expectations and institutional pressure, one particular work begins to torment her. As the opening day approaches, Carla sinks into a state of isolation, insomnia, and paranoia, where the line between reality and hallucination becomes increasingly fragile.
response.tagline: When a work of art looks at you for too long, it ceases to be just art.
response.title: Transfiguración: La mirada que me habita
